intro: Centaurea chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean star-thistle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its spiky, purple-blue flower heads and is often found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, bract-like leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is adapted to thrive in harsh environmental conditions. Centaurea chilensis is also known for its ornamental value and has been introduced to other parts of the world.
